data.title: MAD TANK : ripple/cracks effect
data.body:
IMO, something is missing during the MAD TANK (#4005) attack: I think a rippple animation under the tank (on the ground) would be a cool effect to see.

Here is my first test for an animation:
![animation2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1515031/b124f7c0-4afb-11e3-996e-60dfcea550ee.gif)

Now I just have to convert this animation into a SHP file (I guess it's the way to add this animation into the game). @pchote told me about a yaml file but I will need help on that point.

data.title: Make actor names case sensitive
data.body:
Actor names are forced to lower case when loading the yaml, but the trait properties that reference them aren't. This leads to the inconsistent situation where traits can crash despite the author using consistent naming.

~~We could fix this without adding .ToLowerInvariant() everywhere by doing it once in FieldLoader during the TraitInfo creation.~~

The better approach is to remove *all* the `ToLowerInvariant`s through the actor name parsing code and write an upgrade rule that does a case-insensitive match to [ActorReference] and map actor definitions, then replaces them with the properly cased version.

data.title: Make vertical separators (on drop-down menus) skinnable
data.body:
I think white separators don't look very nice on the UI (they don't match buttons borders).

![separator1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1509079/5d939fd2-4a31-11e3-89fa-f80337f83f05.png)

To solve this, Mailaender told me to modify this line:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/fc49950fd417017d9fafac53726cd831f6dd9af6/OpenRA.Game/Widgets/DropDownButtonWidget.cs#L41

He also kindly adviced me to use system pre-defined colors because they are more convenient than RGB values. Example of possible colors: 
- http://www.dotnetperls.com/color-table
- http://msdn.microsoft.com/fr-fr/library/vstudio/system.drawing.color%28v=vs.110%29.aspx

Here are some choices:
![516979colors](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1509093/6bebba46-4a32-11e3-9ccd-492cb84cd0c8.png)

But instead of modifying this line, Mailaender suggested with due the idea of drawing this separator like the rest of the UI to make it skinnable (because, this separator is currently shared with other mods).

I think it's a good idea to add this separator into dialog.png
And btw, it's not even necessary to draw a new separator in dialog.png files since we can reuse one of the button borders.

Since this separator is a 1x19 px rectangle, here is what its chrome.yaml declarations could be:

```
# Used for vertical separator on drop-down menus
separator: dialog.png
    separator: 512,0,1,19
```

I've been told that the lines that need to be edited are around line 39:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/fc49950fd417017d9fafac53726cd831f6dd9af6/OpenRA.Game/Widgets/DropDownButtonWidget.cs#L39

But I am not a developer so.. that's why I am posting this issue.
EDIT: I will try to work on it but it's a long way... :)

data.title: Remember lobby option checkbox states
data.body:
I think it could be interesting if Map Options (shroud, fog of war, crates appear...) could be remembered after modificating them.

This way, a player could create new games according to his preferences (and without always having to re-enable them each time a new game is created).

Same for the Debug (Developer Mode), checkboxes could be saved too.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1303339-remember-lobby-option-checkbox-states?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add a drop-down menu (in Settings) to quickly change resolution
data.body:
Please add a drop-down menu in the Display Settings to quickly change resolution.

No need to remove the textfields (those which are used to manually enter a custom resolution) but a new menu could list common resolutions (4:3 and 16:9) as well as the last entered custom resolution.

![resolution](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1508824/b67f2b80-4a1c-11e3-8168-a11622dcc4f0.gif)

data.title: Dune 2000 : the Anti-Terraforming Nuke Bomb (or better: Truck)
data.body:
What about adding a new highly dangerous weapon in Dune 2000 : the Anti-Terraforming Nuke Bomb (temporary name...).

I had the idea after re-reading this issue: #3082 (which is about a thumper that can terraform the map and make solid tiles appear where there were sand before, thus creating new lands where players can place their base on).

The goal of the Anti-Terraforming Nuke bomb would do exactly the contrary... 
It could destroy units, buildings and even the ground tiles ! Those (land tiles) would be replaced by sand ones.. :)

Of course it would take a long time to be able to launch it (same duration as the thumper ?) but this could bring amazingly tense situations during combat ;-) 
..as well as strategic actions (blocking roads or escape paths..)

data.body: introduced by #4102. This will crash Windows clients pretty badly.

data.body: Regressed by #4094.

data.title: Cap the frame rate by default
data.body: to increase performance.

data.title: Fix MAD Tank damage model
data.body: Fixes #4105

data.title: Community voxels have incorrect scaling / bounds.
data.body:
From the [PPM forums](http://www.ppmsite.com/forum/viewtopic.php?p=496773):

> the problem is that community voxels use the XYZ scale values inside the voxel to scale it down ingame compared to its base dimensions, for a somewhat 'smoothing' effect, or to make it wider, shorter or whatever without having to redo the voxel. This works absolutely fine in TS and RA2, but OpenRA seems to treat those values as bounds instead, as a result any voxel with scale values lower than its actual dimensions will have parts cut off/shown at the wrong position.

This seems to contradict the format description from ra2ff.txt, but would certainly explain the issues that we see.

data.title: Inform players ingame of latest versions
data.body:
Only very few people test Playtests or even know about them (mostly OpenRA fans on the IRC channel). 

Reasons: Players prefer stable versions (that's understandable) or they are not informed enough (the information may not be clear enough on the website).

To solve my second guess: 
- #4087
- I think OpenRA should check at startup for new versions and display them on the Main Menu Screen.

![versions](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1507505/d15616c6-4986-11e3-85bc-d229db72e6f5.png)

data.body: as proposed in #4033.

Added Player (Spectator) or Player (Team 1) has disconnected message
data.body: as requested in #3864.

data.title: Allow the display of unknown IP addresses
data.body: The `ipAddress == null` check is superfluous as all following formatter and lookup functions can cope with null. Also null does not automatically mean that the local UPnP lookup should be used. #3833

data.title: Options: OpenRA.MapOptions is added to every map
data.body: and the old map options will be overwritten.

data.title: Fixed broken build palette hotkeys
data.body: as reported by @ScottNZ in IRC.

data.title: MAD Tank deals too much damage
data.body: Introduced in #4086. It should only deal damage to actors once instead of doing it for how many tiles the actor takes up like the normal damage model, but without the falloff characteristics of the normal damage model.
